body.p:
Glasgow Ky January 1st ^64^
To Thomas E Bramblet
Governor of Kentucky

We are & have been acquainted with one G. W. Dunn now confinded in the State prison for Some offence (we understand) commited at Louisville Ky we know nothing of the charge or offince. But we know that Said Dunn has always been regarded as an honest peacible citizen was & is now or at the time of the offence a soldier of the 34th regt of Ky Vols If he be guilty of Said offence he certainly was superinduced by bad men who had controle of him He as a poor man has a wife and two little children - - - We now wish respectfully & earnestly for you to extend him pardon - -

=37th Ky Vol
B J Spalding Lieut Conl=
Governor Bramblet
Dear Sir
From all that I can learn about the condition of young Dunn It would be I think right to pardon him and I hope you will do so and let him return to the army
The undersigned Union soldiers would wish Dunn's pardon
